concept.title: Non-rooted topics
concept.shortdesc: A non-rooted topic is one that does not have a home. It has no associated storage location in the repository.

section.title: How non-rooted topics are created
section.p: When you create a new topic in AuthorBridge or open one from a local , it is non-rooted because AuthorBridge does not know where you intend for it to reside. It is temporarily residing right inside the browser.

section.title: Drawbacks of non-rooted topics
section.p:
When topics are non-rooted, you can create most of your content but you cannot do any of the following:
create or paste links, and
view or browse for an image.
You have limited functionality for adding a graphic. You can add it by file name only.

section.title: How to fix the problem
section.p: We recommend integrating repository for storing topics. You root a topic by saving it to the configured repository. Unfortunately, you currently have to re-open it from the repository to then have the rooted-version.
Contact Stilo for more information on your integration and repository options.
